lead_paragraph: New rules have gone into effect eliminating a mandatory English proficiency exam for taxi drivers. Now, the test for a license is available in several languages.

headline.print_headline: New York Ends Cabby Hurdle: English Is No Longer Required
headline.main: Know English? For New York Cabdrivers, That’s No Longer Required

snippet: New rules have gone into effect eliminating a mandatory English proficiency exam for taxi drivers. Now, the test for a license is available in several languages....
abstract: New York taxi drivers are no longer required to take English proficiency exam, prompting concerns over whether communication between taxi drivers and passengers could become even more difficult; most taxi drivers in New York were born outside United States and many believe elimination of provision will improve lives of immigrants by making it easier for them to find work.
